job description:
Overview

Accurately interpret, evaluate, and convey inspection vehicle data to facilitate on-going safe operation of pipelines.

Responsibilities
  • Performs initial run checks to ensure inspection data meet clients’ minimum specifications within contractual requirements, 
  • Identifies all instances of metal loss for the inspected pipeline length, 
  • Determines all pipeline features, fittings and locations in order to provide a comprehensive customer report, 
  • Collates and documents all quality checked inspection data in order to produce a comprehensive overview of the pipeline integrity per client-specified standards; 
  • Completes assigned online training modules and participates in classroom/workshop sessions to gain experience in Pipeline Inspection Technology Level II and Level II QC material, 
  • Acquires knowledge and skills necessary to obtain the industry standard Data Analyst Level II, in compliance with industry standard, 
  • As a Level II DA, works toward Senior Data Analyst once requirements set forth in TDW procedure D1306 Qualified QC Analyst are met, 
  • Coordinates with the software development team in areas of fault finding and possible methods of process improvement, 
  • Updates job tracking methods and monitors own work to ensure timely project milestone completion, 
  • Attends scheduled meetings and trainings to ensure adherence to current TDW initiatives and processes, 
  • Maintains applicable knowledge of TDW standards and industry practices for use in the absence of client-defined values.
Qualifications
  • High School Diploma required; Bachelor’s Degree preferred, 
  • Certification level corresponding to a minimum of Data Analyst Level I in compliance with industry standard, 
  • Demonstrated ability to be detail oriented, 
  • Good basic mathematics skills, 
  • Good verbal and written communication skills in English, and/or other local language, if required, 
  • Proficient personal computer skills and intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel. 
  • Ability to learn new internal software programs.
